name: beluga
content:
beluga noun
(ANIMAL)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ C ] plural beluga or belugas (also beluga whale, white whale) a small white whale that lives mainly in the Arctic: Biologists are trying to find out what is endangering belugas in the Cook Inlet. These beluga whales live under three feet of ice in the freezing waters of northern Russia's White Sea.
W6/iStock/Getty Images Plus/GettyImages
[ C ] plural beluga or belugas (also beluga sturgeon) a large fish that lives mainly in lakes and rivers in central Europe and Asia. It is is a type of sturgeon and is usually caught for its eggs, which are eaten as caviar: Beluga is the largest freshwater fish on earth. It can take a female beluga sturgeon 25 years to produce her first eggs.
Zocha_K/E+/GettyImages
More examplesFewer examplesKiller whales are the beluga's only marine predator. With binoculars you can watch the beluga whales that swim with the summer tide in and out of the river estuary.Polar bears' main source of food is seals, but they sometimes eat walruses and even beluga whales.Lake sturgeon are comparable in size and color to beluga.He imported some belugas from overseas to raise for their eggs and meat.A beluga sturgeon swims slowly through the murky water.
